com.phunware.core

Class PwCoreSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.phunware.core.PwCoreSession

  • public final class PwCoreSession
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages session start, stop and registration.

    • Field Detail

      • SESSION_TIMER

        public static final int SESSION_TIMER
        A session is stopped using: activityStopSession(android.app.Activity). After this amount of time (in seconds), the session will expire.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • PwCoreSession

        protected PwCoreSession()

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static PwCoreSession getInstance()
        Return an instance of PwCoreSession. This will provide a handle to be able to start and stop sessions.
        Returns:
        A MaaS Core session instance.
        See Also:
        activityStartSession(android.app.Activity), activityStopSession(android.app.Activity)

      • killSession

        public static void killSession()
        This will completely wipe out all session-related data as well as keys. If this is called, registerKeys(Context, String, String, String, String) must be called again to start a new session. This should only be used for testing purposes.

      • activityStartSession

        public void activityStartSession(android.app.Activity activity)
        Start or persist session. Call this on every Activity onStart() method.

        If a session doesn't exist, then a new session will be created. If a session was recently stopped using activityStopSession(Activity), then it can be resumed by calling this method before the session expires.

        RuntimeException will be thrown if registerKeys(Context, String, String, String, String) was not called first in Application.onCreate().

        Parameters:
        activity - The current Activity.
        See Also:
        SESSION_TIMER

      • activityStopSession

        public void activityStopSession(android.app.Activity activity)
        Stop session. Call this on every Activity onStop().

        The session will be stopped but can be resumed by calling activityStartSession(Activity) before the session expires.

        RuntimeException will be thrown if registerKeys(Context, String, String, String, String) was not called first in Application.onCreate().

        Parameters:
        activity - The current Activity.
        See Also:
        SESSION_TIMER

      • getAccessKey

        public java.lang.String getAccessKey()
        Get the Access Key that was registered in one of the variations of registerKeys(Context, String, String, String, String).
        Returns:
        Access Key

      • getSessionId

        public java.lang.String getSessionId(android.content.Context context)
        Get the current Session ID. If there is no active session, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        context - Non-null context to work with.
        Returns:
        Session ID, or null if none is active.

        Returns:

      • isFreshInstall

        public boolean isFreshInstall()
        Check if the app has started from a fresh installation.
        Returns:
        True if the app is on a fresh install; false if not.

      • isSessionStarted

        public boolean isSessionStarted()
        Check if the session has been started.
        Returns:
        True if the session is started and running; false if not started or paused.

      • installModules

        public void installModules(com.phunware.core.CoreModule... modules)
        Install MaaS modules here. It must be called before making any additional calls to PwCoreSession, including registerKeys(Context, String, String, String, String). This must be called in Application.onCreate() and should only be called once. Example usage:

        PwCoreSession.installModules(PwAlertsModule.getInstance(), ...);

        Parameters:
        modules - New instance of a CoreModule.

      • registerKeys

        public final void registerKeys(android.content.Context context)
        This should be called after installModules(CoreModule...) and before making any additional calls to PwCoreSession. This must be called in Application.onCreate(). This performs initializations and setup that is required by other method calls.

        Use this in place of registerKeys(Context, String, String, String, String) if you choose to set the keys in the manifest.

        i.e.
        <meta-data android:name="META_DATA_APPLICATION_ID" android:value="APPLICATION_ID_HERE" />
        <meta-data android:name="META_DATA_ACCESS_KEY" android:value="ACCESS_KEY_HERE" />
        <meta-data android:name="META_DATA_SIGNATURE_KEY" android:value="SIGNATURE_KEY_HERE" />
        <meta-data android:name="META_DATA_ENCRYPTION_KEY" android:value="ENCRYPTION_KEY_HERE" />

        Parameters:
        context - application context

      • registerKeys

        public final void registerKeys(android.content.Context context,
                java.lang.String applicationId,
                java.lang.String accessKey,
                java.lang.String signatureKey,
                java.lang.String encryptionKey)
        This should be called after installModules(CoreModule...) and before making any additional calls to PwCoreSession. This must be called in Application.onCreate() if not using registerKeys(Context). This performs initializations and setup that is required by other method calls.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        applicationId - You can find your Application Key in the MaaS portal.
        accessKey - A unique key that identifies the client making the request. You can find your Access Key in the MaaS portal.
        signatureKey - A unique key that is used to sign requests. The Signature Key is used to both check request authorization and as data integrity. You can find your Signature Key in the MaaS portal.
        encryptionKey - The key used to encrypt and decrypt data that is exchanged between the client and the server. You can find your Encryption Key in the MaaS portal.

      • getEnvironmentString

        public java.lang.String getEnvironmentString()
        Debugging helper. Get an informational string based on currently installed modules.
        Returns:
        debug string

      • getDeviceId

        @Deprecated
public java.lang.String getDeviceId()
        Deprecated. 
        Instead, use getSessionData().getDeviceId() Get the Device ID. This is generated by OpenUDID.
        Returns:
        Device ID string
